Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl

Class Ellipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.VisibleObject
      • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl.Ellipse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable
    public class Ellipse
extends VisibleObject
    Draws an ellipse. The ellipse's border and fill colors can be set to separate colors. If desired either may be left null and will be transparent.
    Author:
    readda

    • Field Detail

      • dimension

        private java.awt.Dimension dimension
        The width and height dimension of the ellipse in pixels

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ellipse

        public Ellipse​(java.awt.Point location,
               java.awt.Dimension dimension,
               java.awt.Color lineColor,
               java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Create an ellipse. The location coordinates describe the upper-left corner of a square in which the ellipse is inscribed. The dimension will describe the height and width of a rectangle containing the ellipse.
        Parameters:
        location - Point (in pixels) of the upper left corner of the square containing the ellipse
        dimension - The dimension, in pixels, of the rectangle containing the ellipse
        lineColor - The border color (outside edge) of the ellipse. Leave null for no border
        fillColor - The fill color of the ellipse. Leave null for no fill.

    • Method Detail

      • getDimension

        public java.awt.Dimension getDimension()
        Get the dimension, in pixels, of the rectangle in which the ellipse is inscribed.
        Returns:
        The ellipse's containing regtrangle's dimension

      • setDimension

        public void setDimension​(java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        Set the dimension, in pixels, of the rectangle in which the ellipse is inscribed.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The ellipse's containing rectangle's dimension

        public void drawBorder​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject

      • mouseClickDetected

        public boolean mouseClickDetected​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Default implementation only matches the location pixel. Subclasses should override this to detect a click within their area.
        Specified by:
        mouseClickDetected in interface Drawable
        Overrides:
        mouseClickDetected in class VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the mouse click
        y - The Y coordinate of the mouse click
        Returns:
        True if the X, Y coordinate lies within the Drawable's area
        See Also:
        Drawable.isClickable()
